intro: Aetheilema haenkei, commonly known as the rock cress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale yellow. The plant features pinnately divided leaves and is often found in rocky or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid regions. It is native to parts of southern Africa and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Aetheilema haenkei is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in rock gardens.
